candidates.title: fix: update version and prepare for beta release

milestone.title: v0.9 release
milestone.description: v0.9.0 release should be released after rust 1.75 released.

candidates.body: `tls` and `http-*` won't be published.

candidates.title: feat: update rustls to 0.22.0-alpha.4
candidates.body: We can use the `read_buf` nightly feature with this new release.

candidates.title: feat: make `Runtime` public
candidates.body: It's a little painful to force the users to use a thread local runtime, especially when dropping it. We need to expose the runtime type. This makes some logic a bit more complex. Here I write a guard type `EnterGuard` to control the "current" runtime. `Attacher` will also check if the attached runtime is the current runtime.

milestone.title: v0.9 release
milestone.description: v0.9.0 release should be released after rust 1.75 released.

candidates.title: refactor: organize crates
candidates.body:
* Move some tests to corresponding crates.
* Update version numbers.
* Use workspace dependencies for common deps.
* Add a clippy CI and deny warnings.

candidates.title: feat: HTTP client
candidates.body:
This first PR adds a simple HTTP client with some found bug fixes.

Cookies support and compression are in the following PRs.

candidates.title: feat: more async file operations
candidates.body:
This PR aims to add these operations:
- [x] OpenFile
- [x] ~~CreateSocket~~
- [x] CloseFile
- [x] CloseSocket
- [x] Shutdown

Closes #124

candidates.title: feat(tls): add native-tls adapters.
candidates.body: Working on simple TLS support.

candidates.title: Make DNS resolve async on Unix
candidates.body: Just spawn a thread and wait it.

candidates.title: feat(driver): fusion driver
candidates.body:
This PR added fusion driver, which will be enabled when both `io-uring` and `polling` are enabled, and will determine which to use during runtime. 

However, this does bring some overhead throughout the lifetime of the driver:

- The driver is an enum internally, meaning more branching
- Several OpCodes are now enum too due to divergence between `io-uring` and `polling` implementations.
- A one-time detection will be made when the first fusion driver is instantiated

@nazar-pc what do you think?

Closes #105

candidates.title: Async DNS resolve
candidates.body:
Closes #98 

- [x] Windows
- [x] Linux glibc
- [ ] Unix

candidates.title: Use IO traits in net & fs.
candidates.body: And change *_at to use u64. We should use rustix's `pread` and `pwrite`, but that's a huge change. So I'm opening this first. After this PR, I'll work on #91 , and finally change `libc` to `rustix`.

candidates.title: Use `compio-macros` in tests
candidates.body: This PR change `compio::test` in tests to `compio_macros::test`, and make it a mandatory dev dependency. `macros` feature of `compio` is optional, meaning tests have to be runned with feature flag. This also makes RA happy (instead of yelling macro not exist).

candidates.title: Add custom `IoSlice`
candidates.body: This PR adds `IoSlice` and `IoSliceMut` to `compio-buf` to provide a more flexible api compare to the std one.

candidates.title: Add unix pipe.
candidates.body: Add named pipe (FIFO) and anonymous pipe.

candidates.title: Add a multi-threading dispatcher
candidates.body:
Blocker: #85 

The example & test is alike. Do you have some advice? /cc @George-Miao @bdbai

candidates.title: Use SetFileCompletionNotificationModes when attaching.
candidates.body:
Some IO methods may success immediately. However, it will also issue a packet to IOCP. Now in #82 we've allowed success immediately in `push`, so it is possible to handle these methods, and disable the packet issue.

We can disable the inner event handle of file object as well. It may improve the performance a little.

## Reference

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-US/troubleshoot/windows/win32/asynchronous-disk-io-synchronous

https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20190719-00/?p=102722

https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20200221-00/?p=103466

https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/pull/15141

candidates.title: Allow returning ready on push
candidates.body: `Runtime::submit` is called after first `Future::poll`, so it's OK to return ready on push.

candidates.title: Attempt to split into multiple crates
candidates.body:
Closes #70 

However, I don't think it's easy to do so. Many `pub(crate)` elements are turned into public.

TODO:

- [x] Split the tests to multiple crates.
- [x] Fix the doc tests.
- [x] Unify the crate metadata.

@George-Miao Do you like this attempt?

candidates.title: Add `main` and `test` macros as wrappers of `compio::task::block_on`
fix: use `arrayvec` from `compio-buf`

candidates.title: Separate Buf crate
candidates.body: This PR move buf mod into a separate crate for better reusability

candidates.title: Compio IO crate
candidates.body:
This PR adds `compio-io` and async `Read`/`Write` counterpart traits like those in `tokio`, `futures` and `monoio`.

- [X] The traits
- [X] Extension traits
- [x] Buf{Reader/Writer}
- [x] Util functions
- [x] Tests

candidates.title: Make polling available on Linux.
candidates.body: Linux system which doesn't enable io-uring can use epoll instead. However, epoll doesn't support disk files, which means the file IO is synconized.

candidates.title: Try to use polling instead of mio.
candidates.body:
@George-Miao you've always want this:)

However I've found some problems:

* The `key` of `Event` is said to identify the fd, I don't know whether an fd could be registered with multiple different keys.
* Don't know if it is allowed to add one fd several times with different keys.

Bonus: Closes #67

candidates.title: Make driver safe
candidates.body:
Introduced a new safe wrapper called `PollDriver`.

Maybe need to name it `Driver`, and change the original `Driver` type to `NativeDriver`.

candidates.title: Use ArrayVec if possible.
candidates.body:
Is it sound? I'm not sure.

/cc @George-Miao

candidates.body: This a WIP PR that adds mio support for all non-{linux, windows} platform.

candidates.title: runtime dependencies are optional, once_cell is needed only for Rust …
candidates.body:
At the moment I'm interested in the driver code to build custom runtime, potentially not async.

So I made runtime-related dependencies optional. Besides I moved `once_cell` dependency to non default "once_cell" feature. For Rust version >= 1.70 OnceCell/OnceLock is part of `std`.

candidates.title: Maintain squeue & cqueue manually in io-uring.
Add some test port from monoio.
candidates.body: And fix some bugs.

candidates.title: Add networking operations.
candidates.body: `recvfrom` & `sendto` not implemented for io-uring.

candidates.title: Add more tests & fix.
candidates.body: Port from tokio-iocp.

At the moment I'm interested in the driver code to build custom runtime, potentially not async.

So I made runtime-related dependencies optional. Besides I moved `once_cell` dependency to non default "once_cell" feature. For Rust version >= 1.70 OnceCell/OnceLock is part of `std`.

chosen_detail.title: runtime dependencies are optional, once_cell is needed only for Rust …
chosen_detail.body:
At the moment I'm interested in the driver code to build custom runtime, potentially not async.

So I made runtime-related dependencies optional. Besides I moved `once_cell` dependency to non default "once_cell" feature. For Rust version >= 1.70 OnceCell/OnceLock is part of `std`.

repo.name: completeio
repo.description: A thread-per-core Rust IO drivers and async runtime backed by io_uring/kqueue/IOCP.

repo.name: compio
repo.description: A thread-per-core Rust runtime with IOCP/io_uring/polling.
